response.overview: This film immerses us in the life of a famous prisoner, Jean Zay, who was held for four years because of his political beliefs and the violently antisemitic climate, in Clermont-Ferrand, Marseille, and then Riom. The Minister of National Education and Fine Arts under the Popular Front was assassinated by the Vichy militia on June 20, 1944.
response.title: Haute solitude
